intro: Hylotelephium telephium subsp. fabaria, commonly known as the Armenian carpet or Armenian rose, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers in late summer, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to retain water in arid environments. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in rocky or well-drained soils.
